abstract: The British oil giant said it would cut an additional 5,000 jobs by the middle of next year in an effort to slim management and make the company more efficient.
snippet: The British oil giant said it would cut an additional 5,000 jobs by the middle of next year in an effort to slim management and make the company more efficient.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  BP, the British oil giant, announced on Tuesday that it would cut an additional 5,000 jobs by the middle of next year, part of a plan by the chief executive, Anthony B. Hayward, to slim management and make the company more efficient.

headline.main: BP Misses Estimates and Plans More Job Cuts
headline.print_headline: BP Plans 5,000 Additional Job Cuts After Posting Profit That Missed Estimates
